attributes.action: Allow cannabis oil to be prescribed for terminally ill cancer patients
attributes.background: The UK has recently approved medical cannabis oil on the NHS but not for terminal cancer patients. All terminal cancer suffers should be able to receive cannabis oil. Please sign this petition and let's give these suffers hope of a more fulfilled life.

attributes.action: CEO total income capped to no more than 60 times the lowest employee income.
attributes.background:
FTSE 100 CEOs are now paid:

•    165 times more than a nurse.

•    140 times more than a teacher.

•    132 times more than a police officer.

I want CEO pay capped to a 60 times ratio of the lowest paid in the company. If they want a pay rise everyone should get one.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/taxonomy/term/136

attributes.action: In an effort to reduce plastic wastage, ban the use of multi-pack plastic film.
attributes.background: The aim of this petition is to reduce the use of single-use plastic, and the litter associated with it. Any steps taken to stop the flow of plastics to our oceans are to be welcomed - this extra packaging is unnecessary and is posing a threat to marine life.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/food/2018/sep/06/carlsberg-to-replace-plastic-ring-can-holders-with-recyclable-glue

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/single-use-plastic-carrier-bags-why-were-introducing-the-charge/carrier-bags-why-theres-a-5p-charge

attributes.action: I would like it to be made compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth.
attributes.background: I believe that it is the number 1 human right to know who you are. Technology makes this possible it needs to be compulsory so people don’t find out in adulthood that their biological father isn’t who they thought it was.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to step in and make it compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth and give the child the knowledge of who their fathers are and vice versa
 
The DNA sample should be destroyed and other further information should be taken. The result should be entered on a child's birth certificate.
 
I am a mother and I believe children and men need to know who they are related too. It will takes away doubt and makes for a more confident, honest society, for children to grow up in.

attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Bring Welfare Assessments back to the DWP and scrap contracts with providers
attributes.background: There are widespread reports of Capita producing PIP and ESA assessments that are inaccurate, contain factual errors and ignore important evidence. There are too many appeals being lost by the DWP because of Capita's incompetence.
attributes.additional_details: People are being made seriously ill as a result of the appalling record of Capita’s assessments. It seems Capita make headlines about errors and omissions in all their govt contracts but the most serious is their atrocious record in Welfare assessments.

attributes.action: Solar households should not be made to give away excess power to energy firms
attributes.background: "The government has said households that install solar panels in the future (April 2019) will be expected to give away unused clean power for free to energy firms earning multimillion-pound profits". This is deeply unfair and gives no incentive to make green changes.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/dec/18/solar-power-energy-firms-government?CMP=fb_gu&fbclid=IwAR2c0V8vm3sMUlCfdKCQHg0KWz728VzpYZ69gGbNho-3I6cj1d4L0pjgSyM

attributes.action: Do not legislate to renew community radio licences after 15 years - readvertise!
attributes.background: At 15 years we think the question must be asked "is this proposal still the best one out there? Could someone else do better?". Currently community radio licences stop at 15 years and have to be fully readvertised. Politicians are discussing allowing further blind renewals, which we think is wrong.
attributes.additional_details: Originally community radio licences were intended to be awarded for a 5-year term. Parliament then extended this to 10-years, then 15.   However these extensions do not ask the question "Is this the best use of the radio spectrum?". 15 years ago most towns/cities had local radio stations, now most are networked shows. Many community stations also have had changed and for some the original cause/reason no longer even exists. 15 years is enough - ask again who is making the best offering locally?

attributes.action: Launch an inquiry into the possible link between cannabis and violence
attributes.background: Cannabis is a common factor in an alarming number of violent crimes, including murder, rape and child abuse, as well as suicide. As calls for the legalisation of cannabis grow ever louder, we demand the government first investigate the possible link between cannabis and violence.
attributes.additional_details: As documented in this blog, https://attackersmokedcannabis.com/, cannabis is a common factor in hundreds of violent crimes that have occurred in the UK and Ireland in the past two decades.

attributes.action: Make guide dogs available as part of the mobility scheme, not reliant on charity
attributes.background: There is nothing more curtailing of your independence and mobility than sight loss, funds should be available via the mobility scheme to train a guide dog rather than people being reliant on charitable funds.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Remove hemp from schedule 1 and reclassify as an agricultural crop.
attributes.background: We are calling for the immediate withdrawal of hemp from Schedule 1 and urgent reclassification as an industrial and agricultural crop. It should not be regulated under the Misuse of Drugs Act at all, let alone put in the most restrictive category alongside dangerous class As.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit looming, the UK needs to become self-reliant for our sources of food, energy, fuel and raw materials. Hemp is the perfect crop to provide all of these. Hemp seeds are a nutritionally complete food. The plant could replace cotton. It's an abundant source of cellulose so can make paper and plastic. It needs no pesticides, pulls carbon from the atmosphere, prevents soil erosion and absorbs toxins from the soil, helping to prevent climate change, and it only takes 3 months to grow.

attributes.action: Parliament rule out National Parks and AONBs as sites for nuclear waste disposal
attributes.background: MPs approved a new plan for the UK’s most toxic radioactive materials. The move means protected areas like national parks and areas of outstanding natural beauty (AONB) would be potential sites for waste disposal facilities. We MUST have parliament rule out our national treasures as a dumping ground
attributes.additional_details:
After efforts to find a home for the UK’s nuclear waste stalled, the government launched a new strategy that has since undergone scrutiny by the Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) Committee. After hearing evidence from key stakeholders, the committee has released a report in which they refuse to rule out protected areas as potential dumping sites. - Josh Gabbatiss, Science Correspondent for the Independent.

Ruth Bradshaw, CNP’s policy and research manager, said: “The decision not to recommend excluding national parks and AONBs as possible locations also goes against the government’s ambitions for these areas as set out in the 25-year environment plan."

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

•Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

•Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

•UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

•Liberal Democrats - 8 seats, 2,415,916  votes (7.9%)

•Green Party - 1 seat, 1,57,630 votes (3.8%)


2017 Election:

•Conservatives - 318 seats, 13,636,684 votes (42.4%)

•Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

•Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

•UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Reinstate DLA for those with mental health or learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Personal Independence Payments criteria is frightfully ill-suited for those claimants that have a form of learning difficulty or mental health condition. The PIP criteria is dreadfully preposterous for this division of society. We are asking the government to reinstate DLA for these groups.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like the government to reconsider their options in regards to reinstating the Disability Living Allowance Criteria for this group of claimants. The following links back up the point of this petition.
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-fit-to-work-assessments-cost-more-than-they-save-report-reveals-a6801636.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-mental-health-discrimination-pip-cuts-mobility-mind-a7629866.html

attributes.action: Recoup NHS treatment costs from anyone convicted of domestic violence offences.
attributes.background: My plan would be to use the U.K. Courts system to recoup the costs of treating domestic violence victims by applying an additional financial penalty (to anyone convicted of domestic violence) that fully covers the costs of any NHS treatment that arises as a result of a person’s criminal act.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year, it is estimated, that it costs the NHS approximately £5.5 billions Sterling to treat victims of domestic violence.Please See link below.
https://www.trustforlondon.org.uk/news/domestic-violence-costs-55bn-year-england/
Surely these NHS treatment costs could be recouped from anyone convicted of an offence of domestic violence or abuse by using the U.K Law Courts to apply an additional financial penalty to perpetrators of domestic violence offences?

attributes.action: Ban the Nazi salute in the UK
attributes.background: The Nazi salute is an insult to those who fought and died for peace during World War Two. Therefore it should be banned in the UK because it offends the Jewish community.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit on the motorways/dual carrigeways to 85mph!
attributes.background: 1967 was the year when the 70mph speed limit was set, since then cars, roads and driving moral improved a lot. Today 90% of the cars on the roads been made after 2005, these cars are all equipped with all the safety features to safely travel on higer speed.
attributes.additional_details:
Higher speed limit must come with mandatory minimum that should be 60mph!

Belgium, France, Holland, Germany all has a higher speed limit than Uk to improve the traffic flow on their motorways, in my personal opinion this could be a solution for England aswell.

Austria just started to test a new 87mph speed limit on a 30miles section, if that works well they will raise the limit on all of their motorways.

attributes.action: Right to buy for ALL social housing tenants, a fair chance at security for all!
attributes.background: Myself (tenant for 17 years) and my mother (tenant for 25 years) would like to buy our homes but neither of us qualify despite all our neighbours qualifying because they were tenants before the properties transferred to Housing association and our properties miss right to acquire rules by 1 year
attributes.additional_details:
It’s discrimination to say 1 has a right and 1 doesn’t. 
We are in the same properties on the same street owned by the same Housing association but those that want to buy can’t and those that can don’t want to! 
Give us a right to buy the homes we have lived in, raised our children in and made our own. Give our children security for their futures.
When we applied for social housing it’s because we had no alternative, now let us buy our HOMES and use the money for much needed additional housing!

attributes.action: Make supermarkets STOP using plastic and start using more sustainable packaging
attributes.background: We have “12 years to limit climate change catastrophe” (IPPC) I cannot help but look around at these huge corporations that are constantly using up energy and plastic (creating what I can only imagine are vast amounts of waste) If we want to keep the world turning let’s DO something about it!!
attributes.additional_details: I know it’s not a quick fix issue but I think, even if just one corporation changed, a huge difference would be made. This discussion needs to continue and has to evolve into actions if the situation is going to get any better. People need to be educated into the importance of recycling and how it is to be carried out because, I know it’s hard to believe, but some people have no idea what can and can’t be recycled! Please help change occur and sign this petition to start conversations and action

attributes.action: Make all products state on the label whether they have used animal testing
attributes.background: Many people are against animal testing or want to reduce the number of products they buy that use it but there isn't enough information in store about the companies that use animal testing so people are generally unaware about the extent of it. This addition would allow a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: Due to medical progress now, many agree that animal testing should only be used when completely necessary yet the U.K. are still estimated to be in the top 9 testers in the world. People should be more aware of what's go in to the product in front of them, right there in the shop without having to search online. At total of 3.79 million experiments were conducted by the U.K. In 2017

attributes.action: Remove the verbal option from Food Information Regulations on Allergens.
attributes.background:
With so many people now suffering food allergies and other food related conditions, it is not acceptable for anyone to rely on word of mouth about the ingredients used.
It is not possible for staff to remember every ingredient in a dish, and there needs to be documentation to prove due diligence.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is considered acceptable for food businesses to provide allergen information verbally, however, with the high staff turnover for which the hospitality industry is renowned, this is not adequate, safe, reliable, or practical. 
It is much more practical to provide written documents with full ingredients lists, to use standardised recipes, and have staff trained on accredited courses. In a court of law, a business must 'prove due diligence', this, surely, cannot be achieved verbally.

attributes.action: Enhanced Maternity / Paternity Benefits for Employees of Large Corporations
attributes.background: I wish for it to be made a legal requirement for large corporate companies who employee over 50,000 employees to pay enhanced Maternity / Paternity benefits as some industry leaders already do. The gap between the government minimum&some industry leaders is outstanding eg. Ford pay 52 weeks full pay
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was lucky enough to fall pregnant&welcome my first child in to the world. Before I did so, I was completely unaware of the difference between the maternity / paternity packages that different large organisations had in place. The difference between you and another Mum / Dad might be in excess of thousands of pounds which makes a huge different to any working family. I propose for all large organisations to pay the same, enhanced package rather than the government minimum guideline.

attributes.action: Ban non 'diet' fizzy drinks having sweeteners in them
attributes.background:
Since the introduction of the sugar tax companies have been changing recipes for their standard drinks to reduce the amount of sugar by adding sweeteners.
For many people who either do not want to drink a 'diet' drink this has become very confusing and in most cases you cannot buy a drink without.
attributes.additional_details:
An example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). 
Or drinks labled 'Regular' or 'Classic' now contain sweetener although there are already no added sugar or diet versions.

The sugar tax has reduced a consumers choice so it is near impossible to buy a drink without sweeteners and it is already being shown that they cause as much a health risk as too much sugar. 
Moderation is the way forward not lack of choice.

attributes.action: Free school meals for everyone including secondary school students.
attributes.background: Many parents work extremely hard whilst caring for their children and lunch fees can become expensive, especially when the number of children they have increase. So free school meals can help them save money and maintain the family.

attributes.action: Make bullying awareness part of the national curriculum in all schools.
attributes.background: I feel too many children are suffering from bullying on a daily basis, and not enough action is being done. Yes schools have posters about zero tolerance on bullying, but how many kids actually pay attention. I feel a minimum of 30 minutes a week classroom time will make children more aware.
attributes.additional_details: I have never struggled with bullying personally, but after reading a heart breaking story of a young boy, who sadly took his own life due to bullying, I feel it is time to integrate bullying awareness into children's lives, and the ideal place for this to take place is in the classroom, across all ages and all schools. I strongly believe a bullying awareness curriculum in schools could lower this stigma and ideally save lives.

attributes.action: Re-instate legal aid in all childrens' cases
attributes.background: Currently the law with regards to legal aid and childrens cases only comes into effect if the case is in a public interest, private cases are not covered under legal aid and because of this those who can not afford a solicitor are being forced to prove they are exempt from paying court costs.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that legal aid is made available on all cases regarding child law so that no person fighting for custody or access under private law is penalized or forced into debt by having to fund court cases over their child, every parent has a right and legal aid should be available for all not just the privileged few that are able to represent themselves. Without this those on benefits are unable to have assistance from solicitors to help with their case

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to humanely kill and eat dogs in the UK.
attributes.background: The killing and eating of a dog is only illegal if the method of slaughter is deemed to have caused unnecessary suffering - otherwise eating the meat is still allowed in the UK. The government must make this a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable plastics, plastic toys  & plastic bags in the UK.
attributes.background:
According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics.
More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050.”
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother of 2 young children I feel now is the time to #endplasticuse4good.
I travelled to Kenya recently and I was surprised to discover that they have banned the use of plactic bags and so on.
We MUST all take action now to save our planet. Please support this petition!
The toy companies must be accountable and be charged for making plastic toys that are easily disposable!

attributes.action: Publish details of the preparations taken in case of ‘no deal’ exit from the EU
attributes.background: The Government has shelved plans to publish details of planing for a no deal exit.  These plans will affect everyone in the UK and therefore it is within the public interest to see these plans.  This petition calls on the government to publish the plans allowing the public to see the preparations

attributes.action: Convert the Charter of Fundamental Rights into UK law for if Brexit happens.
attributes.background: The Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union is important to everybody. It gives people a voice to be heard. The Charter of Rights needs to be converted into UK law after leaving EU so that our rights as humans are fully protected both at home and abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
EU Charter of Rights gives access to proper justice and proper freedom for all without partiality. The UK has had a good history on human rights and protection for its citizens both at home and abroad.

Remember important rights like that of education and healthcare do not exist in UK law they are from the Charter and just a small example of why it is vital that it is retained at UK law in the even of our withdrawal from the EU

attributes.action: Increase funding to police forces
attributes.background: As aired on ‘crimewave 2018: a lawless Britain’ 9 out of 10 crimes go unsolved and police lack resources.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has suffered from the increase of crime especially knife crime as well as an increase of burglaries over the past year, this is the result of decreased funding the government has given the police. We now need the government to give police forces in England and Wales enough funds to be able to put more police officers on our streets to keep the public safe and to increase funding. They should also increase funding to Scotland and Northern Ireland so that they can do the same.

attributes.action: Bring back our job center to Darwen
attributes.background: Bring back our job center to Darwen which closed early this year without even asking the people of darwen if this was ok
attributes.additional_details:
UNEMPLOYED people in parts of East Lancashire will face extra 10 mile round-trips after the Department of Work and Pensions announced it will merge two jobcentres with nearby sites.

As a result of an estates review by the DWP, jobcentres in Green Street, Darwen, and Market Street, Colne, will now be axed.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against Chickenpox
attributes.background: The last four days I have watched my two daughters scream in agony as their Chickenpox became itchy and painful. People presuppose Chickenpox is a mild infection but that is not always the case. It is about time that we eliminated this illness and added it to the childhood immunisation schedule.
attributes.additional_details:
It is assumed that Chickenpox is a mild virus that does not require vaccination. However, this is not always the case and secondary infection can result which can lead to hospital admission and even fatality. The NHS website outlines this in more clinical detail. Another important factor is the sheer anguish and suffering of those who catch it. Chickepox is very itchy and painful and most children find it extremely distressing. When a vaccine is available, would we not choose to eliminate this suffering?
In other countries such as the US and Australia, a vaccine is offered as part of the childhood immunisation schedule. Let us not let cost stop us eliminating this horrible illness once and for all.

attributes.action: Make employers offer part-time working for new parents
attributes.background: Lots of parents who worked full time before having children are unable to do so once the child is born. At present employers are allowed to consider part-time options but they do not have to honour them leaving new mums and dads no option but to resign. The same job level should also be available.
attributes.additional_details: Returning to a role after having a baby is difficult enough, it seems that if you want part-time you have to fight for it and if it is granted the job level you were at before is not always made available to you. I believe that it should be compulsory to offer a part time role at the same level. Parents should not be penalised in the workplace for having a child.

attributes.action: Require companies with 100+ employees to offer a bike2work scheme to all staff
attributes.background:
Many large companies do not offer a bike2work scheme for no reason other than lazyness. 

Lots more people would cycle given the opportunity to do so and as the government is aware cycles are a massive aid in reducing both emissions and congestion it'll benefit everyone in various ways
attributes.additional_details:
It's proven cycling is good for health, less strain on NHS

Cycling instead of driving reduces emissions - less strain on NHS, better for planet, and helps meet city air pollution requirements

Less congestion meaning more profitable businesses, more interest in business, easier access to emergency services

Healthier work forces - less early retirments on medical.grounds, less sick pay etc

attributes.action: Doctors should have priority access to NHS treatment to enable fast returntowork
attributes.background: NHS demand is increasing  with UK increasing and ageing population. Number of doctors is in decline worse affected is General Practice For improving recruitment, retention and workforce capacity allowing Doctors to have fast track access to NHS treatments will help their return back to work quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
The supply of GPs is under growing strain as the workforce ages.
In 2010, more than a fifth of GPs were aged 55 and over; those leaving the profession rose by 7.8 per cent and surveys indicate a further 10,000 GPs plan to retire in the next five years. 
At the same time, the proportion of medical trainees choosing to enter GP specialty training has fallen. AE, mental health, secondary care cant keep the services with no Doctors.

attributes.action: Brexit - Follow a Canada Plus Deal with the EU
attributes.background: In June 2016 the UK voted to leave the EU. We call on our Government to honour our instruction and follow a Canada Plus deal to deliver what was promised.
attributes.additional_details: In June 2016 the UK voted to leave the EU. It was clearly explained in the pre-referendum leaflet what voting ‘leave’ would result in. Our instruction to the Government was for this to be carried out. The Chequers deal does not deliver on this promise and we instruct the Government to negotiate for the future UK/EU relationship to be based on an enhanced version of the EU/Canada Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement to deliver that promise.

attributes.action: A minimum prison sentence of 10 years for attempting to meet after grooming.
attributes.background: Too many crimes are being committed against children on a daily basis, these are wrecking their childhoods and are given poor sentences. I want to see a minimum of 10 yrs for attempting to meet a child after grooming. Not suspended and only rehabiltate inside away from our children. Give us justice.

attributes.action: Create an NHS service equipped to help people with autism & mental health issues
attributes.background:
Many people with Autism struggle to get mental health support despite being 80% more likely to suffer from it!
66% of newly diagnosed individuals have contemplated suicide... this is a ridiculous statistic. 
Change needs to happen!!
attributes.additional_details: I lost my best friend to suicide back in 2015, he had autism and suffered from depression and was on a waiting list for mental health services, however a lot of these services are unequipped and shy away from supporting individuals with autism, because of our communication difficulties. We are often labelled as not engaging due to not being able to verbalise what’s happening as easy as other service users and often get discharged or misunderstood, there needs to be a service that helps us!

attributes.action: Give all farmed animals access to fresh air and daylight.
attributes.background: Farmed animals can be kept in near darkness with no access to fresh air or natural light spending their whole lives in sheds that are little more than dungeons. The denial of natural light and fresh intensifies great suffering to intelligent and sentient life forms.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence of such practices and concomitant suffering is plentiful. I use these examples but there are many. This YouTube film is about the abuses of factory farmed animals but the birds and pigs can clearly be seen to have little or no access to daylight or fresh air - increasing the risks to animal and human health.

https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/press-releases/2017/07/new-interactive-map-exposes-uk-factory-farming-hotspots

https://youtu.be/IVGR1N2Pl00

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty to reduce crime rates in the UK
attributes.background: We believe that bringing back the death penalty will help to reduce crimes being committed and to create a safer community for us and future generations. Also it will help to get murderers and rapists off the streets to make us less worried when going out or letting our children out.
attributes.additional_details: We have previously created a questionnaire to gather peoples views and opinions on whether we should bring back the death penalty or not. We asked 22 local residents a range of different questions when we got the questionnaires back out of the 22 people asked 55% feel as though it should be brought back too create a safer environment for our future generations where as the other 45% feel as though it shouldn't be brought back because it is not right to commit the "an eye for and eye" because it is too harsh of a punishment and what if they were framed then they loose their life for nothing.

attributes.action: Give the RSPCA Statutory Powers to investigate animal welfare complaints
attributes.background: When the RSPCA receives calls on the 24-hour cruelty line its officers are not allowed to intervene and stop any abuse they discover until the Police arrive. The Police having their hands full as it is, cannot always guarantee a quick response which only prolongs the animal's suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving the RSPCA statutory powers (like the Scottish and Irish SPCA) would: 
a) eliminate this waiting for the Police nonsense
b) allow RSPCA inspectors to enter private land where they suspect animal cruelty is taking place
c) allow RSPCA inspectors to remove abused or suffering animals

There are monsters who inflict unjustified suffering on defenseless creatures and RSPCA's role is vital to save animal lives and prevent  cruelty.

attributes.action: Provide loans to help citizens who become seriously ill abroad return home
attributes.background: My uncle, Charlie, had a stroke in Cambodia and was on life support. Repatriation to the UK was £105,000. There must be a contingency plan for sick British nationals with no insurance who need to be repatriated. No British citizen should die because they can't afford medical care.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide a reasonable loan scheme that families can use to get their loved ones home. These loans should be paid back as and when it is realistically possible for the family to do so.

attributes.action: Fine MPs for the non-disclosure of outside earnings and benefits
attributes.background: Following the 30-day suspension of an MP for the non-disclosure of two luxury holidays valued at up to £100,000, the House of Commons should change its rules to allow MPs to be fined half the value of everything they fail to properly disclose. This would improve compliance and public trust.

attributes.action: Make food bill right to protect the most vulnerable people
attributes.background: Protecting & giving people the most basic need that is a food bill right & to making sure everyone had a right to eat & no one go without.  People go to work but no choice to choose between paying bills or put food on the table driving them into debts or those are without benefits/homeless
attributes.additional_details: You only have to look at media and how wrong it is that people are so poor & destitute that are force to live on the street without the mean to getting food.  Also people benefits had been stopped through no fault of their own. So providing foods voucher that cover all types of diets. Those that eat animal products those that are vegetarian & vegans. They can all meet the criteria of eating healthy. This is to protecting the most vulnerable in needs

attributes.action: Insist the UK Government reject advice of the Senior Salaries Review for Judges
attributes.background: The Senior Salaries Review Body has recommended a pay rise of 32% for Judges. The reason given is low moral and changes to their pensions. With many Civil Servants receiving 1% for 10 years in a row, this is totally unacceptable. The Government cannot accept this whilst we are still in austerity
attributes.additional_details: As reported in many newspapers and the BBC on 12 October 2018.

attributes.action: Make 30 hours free child care available to all working parents including non-EU
attributes.background:
The conservative government introduced the 30 hours free child care to all working parents in 2016. This was a very welcomed news as it will help greatly with childcare costs.

I was greatly shocked to realise that we were NOT eligible for the 30hrs because of our immigration status(outside EEA).
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and my husband have been residents in this country for 9 years and we are both working, paying our taxes and NI. We are not entitled to public funds including child tax credit or child benefit.

It is UNFAIR that we get taxed as other working parents/ persons but we are denied the 30 hours free child care. This is harsh, unjust, unacceptable and discriminately. 


https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-brings-forward-plans-to-double-free-childcare-for-working-families

attributes.action: Stop animals being given away as prizes or sold at funfairs.
attributes.background: Carnival fish are often kept in poor conditions in small bags. These bags become very hot on warm days and will run out of oxygen. They're given without any advice on how to care for them. Goldfish live on average 5-10 years in captivity however carnival fish often die shortly after being given.

attributes.action: Make gender-neutral passports available for British citizens
attributes.background: The UK government currently allows only 'M'/'F' gender markers on travel documents, which effectively erases many non-binary and intersex people. I would urge the government to recognise these already marginalised groups.
attributes.additional_details:
In a recent dispute the high court was told gender-neutral passports would affect legislation, be prohibitively expensive and increase the need for consular support for British citizens.

None of which negates the fact that we still need them, whatever the cost, and that if legislation doesn't account for non-binary and intersex people, it badly needs revising.
 
Gender-neutral passports are already recognised internationally. Ten countries currently offer a third gender option, 'X', or unknown.
